name: 4-bromophenyl methyl sulfone
Reason: 4-bromophenyl methyl sulfone has a melting point that we can estimate by considering its structural components. The basic unit for this compound is phenyl, which has a melting point of around 10°C. The methyl sulfone group can increase the melting point due to the presence of a sulfur atom, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and form a rigid structure, raising it by approximately +10°C. The bromine atom can also contribute to the melting point due to its increased molecular weight and electronegativity, which can raise it by approximately +10°C. The presence of a phenyl group can also increase the melting point due to its ability to form hydrogen bonds and create a more rigid structure, raising it by approximately +20°C.
